question: The speed of light $c$, gravitational constant $G$, and Planck's constant $h$ are taken as fundamental units. The dimensional formula for time in this new system is:

A small block is shot into each of the four tracks as shown below. Each track rises to the same height. The speed with which the block enters the track is the same in all cases. In which case is the normal force maximum at the highest point?
options: The normal force is the same for all

question: A massive uniform rigid circular disc is introduced on a frictionless horizontal plane. A horizontal force $F$ is applied tangentially to the highest point. The acceleration of the center of mass is $a$. If the disc were rolling without slipping on a rough surface with the same force, the acceleration would be:

The magnetic flux linked with a coil is $\Phi = 5t^2 + 3t + 16$. The induced EMF in the coil at $t = 4$ s is:
A step-up transformer has a turns ratio of 1:10. A resistance of $20 \Omega$ is connected across the secondary. The equivalent resistance as seen by the primary is:

A solid sphere and a hollow sphere of the same mass and radius are released from the top of an inclined plane. Which one will reach the bottom first?
options: Both reach at the same time
Depends on the angle of inclination

question: The ratio of the speed of sound in nitrogen gas to that in helium gas at the same temperature is:
A capacitor of capacitance $C$ is charged to a potential $V$ and then connected in parallel with an uncharged capacitor of capacitance $2C$. The final potential difference across each capacitor is:
The Brewster angle for a glass-air interface (refractive index of glass $= 1.5$) is:
If the earth stops rotating about its axis, the value of $g$ at the equator will:
A radioactive element has a half-life of 10 days. The fraction of the element that will remain after 30 days is:
The resolving power of a telescope can be increased by:
options: Increasing the focal length of the eye-piece
Increasing the diameter of the objective
Decreasing the focal length of the objective
Increasing the length of the telescope

question: A current $I$ flows through a long straight wire. The magnetic field at a distance $r$ from the wire is $B$. The magnetic field at a distance $r/2$ is:
